subject: Travel
title: Spices Worth More Than Gold
description: A quick, practical guide to Spices Worth More Than Gold.

hook.text: In medieval Europe, a handful of black pepper could pay a month's rent.

buildup.text: Spices traveled thousands of miles from Southeast Asia through Arab middlemen to Europe.

discovery.text: Cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg preserved food, masked bad flavors, and served as medicine.

twist.text: Arab traders invented wild stories about spice origins to keep Europeans from finding the source.

climax.text: They claimed cinnamon grew in lakes guarded by giant birds. Europeans believed it for centuries.

punchline.text: The spice trade ran on monopoly and mythology.

quiz.question: Why did Arab traders invent stories about spice origins?
options: To keep Europeans from finding the source
